title: Solid
text:
I really like this app and these cameras. I just setup 3 mini plusses, 1 mini O and a Vault.  From the mixed reviews I read, I believe the success of the cameras largely depends on one's existing wireless network. 

I have an Orbi network that broadcasts both 5 and 2.4 on the same SSID. I expected this to be an issue though it wasn't. Each camera connected to the network and was working in the app within 1 minute. I formatted the SD card, updated firmware and configured the settings for each camera in well under 10 minutes (each.) 

I think the software is great. Sure, there are a couple of enhancements I will request but so far, it's been solid and very functional. I don't use the cloud clips so I ignore that but I haven't found that to be intrusive.  

The cameras records to local SD card and send to cloud only when a camera senses motion though each camera sends to the vault continually. I didn't expect this and found it to be a nice surprise. The app differentiates between continual stream and motion alerts so it's quick and easy to find activity. It's also very simple to export snapshots and clips. 

If they asked me where to improve, I don't believe anything is well documented so I'm still trying to figure out how a few features work.

title: It Works But...
text:
Like the title says it works but it's lacking in a couple places. This is not a convenient app. My 2 big issues is that there is no easy way to put the camera to sleep from my phone and there's no Apple Watch app. 

First sleep mode - when arriving home I have to open the app, go into settings, then put the camera to sleep. When I don't do this I get a bunch of notifications from the motion sensor. Most times my hands aren't free when I get home so I have to put my things down and clear the notifications , then I can put the camera on sleep mode. There needs to be an easier way like a widget to toggle sleep mode on/off. 

Second Apple Watch app - my phone isn't always next to me but my Watch is always on my wrist. If the camera detects motion and I'm not right there next to my phone (or even looking at it) how will I know that someone is in my place? If I were able to receive the notification on my wrist I would know immediately that there may be an issue. 

Just a couple ways I think the app could be greatly improved but it does what it's supposed to do and the picture is pretty good. This is my first wifi camera so I was just trying it out to see if I would like it. I've decided I like it but I will opt for a different one next time.

title: Decent, but not great
text:
The iPhone 6 was released nearly a year ago, and the app was updated August 15th.  To see an app dedicated to viewing HD security cameras not scale to full screen is, to say the least, annoying.  

I find the entire process of using HIKVision cameras with EZVIZ to be awkward and odd to setup.  1. Enable the feature within the cameras.  
2. Create an account with EZVIZ.  
3. Add each camera using the serial number (only the last 9 digits).
4. Find the device specific password (printed only on the camera body, or SSH to the device (must manually enable) and use ‚ÄòshowKey‚Äô)
5. Login to app.
6. Enter the security key again (oh, you didn‚Äôt write it down? go get the camera off its mount, again (or SSH)).

While the security is nice, using an encryption key that is printed only on the camera body itself is again, annoying‚Ä¶security cameras are mounted in hard to reach locations, away from easy access, and difficult to remove, hopefully.  Then again, EZVIZ isn‚Äôt even touted as a feature of the cameras.  You‚Äôd never know it was for HIKVision cams or supported by the same unless you went out of your way to figure out what the tap was in the cam config).  

Useful, but seriously wonky.  Also, no multi-cam view in the app.  Why?  Because.

title: Needs improvements.
text:
This app works well in that it is fairly reliable for playback and live viewing. 

However, the cons outweigh the pros in my opinion. 

Three major improvements would make this a 5-star app:

1) Make the ability to select part of the camera's view and disable it from motion detection. There are too many false motion triggers from areas of the video screen where repetitive motion occurs (like a road or spinning ceiling fan).

2) Make the ability to DELETE all motion events, not just mark them as read. Scrolling through hundreds of motion triggers 15 at a time takes a long time. 

3) On the playback timeline, instead of just a blue timeline, change the color wherever motion was detected. This way, if you need to lookup when something happened, it will be easier to find knowing the parts of the timeline where motion occurred.
